ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Bah!  All those people who talk about uniqueness have not played high enough levels to compare. A warrior IS unique, but it does not kick in until much later.
ygData.messageBody:
Bah! All those people who talk about uniqueness have not played high enough
levels to compare.

A warrior IS unique, but it does not kick in until much later.

I have not played until level 50, but I did here Brad quote that a human
warrior (or was it barbarian warrior, not sure) gets something like 3000hp
at level 50. 3000!!! That will be a HELL of a lot more than ANY other
class. Its not just a couple hundred hp, its a lot more.

Basically what makes us unique is we can take punishment like no other
class. We can also dish out continuous damage. but we are NOT the mob
killers, wizards are.

My ONLY whine is the "warriors are the only class that can wear all armour
in the game". This is just dishonest. Certain kinds of magic plate can be
worn by ALL other classes. This I REALLY wish they would change. I think
the only classes that should be able to wear plate are Warriors, Paladins
and SK's. I also think the BEST plate in the game should be ONLY wearable
by Warriors.

Its not like we have a lot of weapon choices, we have 1 ultimate weapon
which is unattainable until atleast level 40 or so, its also an axe. So
atleast give us some warrior only armour.

O.K. ill shutup now.



> ----------
> From: slu@...[SMTP:slu@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 5:14 AM
> To: Tom Swift; warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>
> From: <slu@...>
>
> Tom
>
> Yup & the gap seems to get worse the higher in levels you go. Not only
> Rangers, but Paladins & especially Monks seem to greatly diminish the role
> of the warrior at levels 25+. Eventually the other classes have similar
> (within a couple of 100 hps) stats and much more diversity in terms of
> healing & hth damage capability. Mind you that my opinion is based on
> talking with high level players (who have tried to convince me to dump my
> warrior) & from reading on the eqstratics site.
>
> There is an interesting thread on the eqstratics board (warriors)
> regarding the perceived lack of differentiation (or all out weakness) of
> our class at higher levels.
>
> What does the rest of the list think? Anyone have direct experience
> playing these classes at level 30+ & can compare HTH damage &
> effectiveness against critters?
>
> Rob Wilbarg aka Flair in Fennin Ro
>
> > ** Original Subject: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
> > ** Original Sender: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
> > ** Original Date: Mon, 24 May 1999 12:26:45 -0400
>
> > ** Original Message follows...
>
> >
> > This past week I decided to take a break from my level 15 dark elf
> warrior. I was abit frustrated.
> >
> > I started a half-elf warrior in Kelethin. It is insanely easy to play
> there. I made level 5 in about 3.5 hours. Then I stopped and tried a
> wood elf ranger. Has anyone else played a ranger? I imagine it is the
> most poorly balanced of all the hybrids. After 4 hours I reached level 5
> and got kick. I am now 12-18 hours into the character and almost level 9.
> I am just as capable as an equivalent warrior. Next level I gain an array
> of spells which will boost my combat effectiveness and allow me to heal.
> Part of the easy success is the plethora of low level orcs available a
> stone's throw from Kelethin. With my tracking ability I am never at a
> loss for targets and I can engage blue con orcs in rapid succession or
> even 2 at a time. I can even engage and successfully beat yellow con orcs
> more than 50% of the time and almost always can kill orcs that con even to
> me without trouble. So far it seems that I get as many hit points now as
> my warrior did.
> >
> > My point is, with a ranger class as powerful a combatant as it is I see
> little necessity for the pure warrior. I am going to play through to
> level 15 I think, just to see a more even comparison. My concern is only
> from a game mechanics perspective though as I have no doubt my playing as
> a dark elf was a much more rewarding experience. Has anyone else noticed
> that the warrior just is not different enough from the hybrid fighter
> classes?
> >
> > Bael Aelyn
> > Warrior of the 15th Order or Ranger of the 8th Rank
> > Indigo Brotherhood Humble Servant of
> Tunare
> >
> > still undecided
> >
>
>
> >** --------- End Original Message ----------- **
>
> >
>
>
>
